SCENE 1: INT. INSIDE CASKET
ENCLOSED SPACE — THE DOCTOR IS LOCKED INSIDE A LINED AND
COFFIN.
(GASP, SUDDENLY WAKING) Ace! (BEAT) Where are you?
BEAT) Where am I, for that matter. (EFFORT, TRIES TO MOVE
Very tight. Definitely not the TARDIS, then. Not much room for manoeuvre. (TRIES AGAIN, BUT CAN’T MOVE) In fact, I can’t seem to move at all...
SCRAPING OUTSIDE BOX AS IT’S CARRIED AWAY.
(TENTATIVE) Hello? Where are you taking me?
A LIFE OF CRIME (FINAL) Page 3
SCENE 2: EXT. BEACHSIDE TERRACE
LAPPING AND SEABIRDS CALLING IN DISTANCE. FUNEREAL MUSIC PLAYS FROM INSIDE CHAPEL OF REST. MOURNERS EXIT DOWN STEPS ONTO TERRACE, AS GLORIA STANDS BIDDING FAREWELL.
(TO DEPARTING MOURNERS) Thank you for coming. Goodbye. Thank you.
(EXITING CHAPEL) A very tasteful service. Just what he’d have wanted.
Nice to get a chance to say goodbye. It was all so sudden.
SNIFFS, FEIGNING UPSET
(UNCOMFORTABLE) My sincere condolences, Miss Swannicker. Your... associate was one of our most... colourful guests.
Thank you, Mr Mayor. There’s five hundred grotzits in the collection tray for... you know.
Very kind, Madam. Very kind.
If you’ll excuse me. Now everyone’s gone, I’d like a moment alone with the departed.
Of course.
WALKS UP STEPS INTO CHAPEL OF REST. WE FOLLOW MAYOR
OFF ALONG BEACH. HOVERBIKE PULLS UP.
(CALLING) Hey! You there! You need a permit to ride those on the beach.
(CALLING, OFF) Who says?
I do.
TURNS OFF ENGINE AND CLIMBS OFF. SHE STARTS WALKING OVER.
A LIFE OF CRIME (FINAL) Page 4
And who are you to tell people what they can and can’t do?
I, young woman, am the Mayor of Ricosta. As such, fully versed in all bye-laws, regulations, fines and the enforcement thereof.
(ARRIVING) Give me a break. I’ve only just arrived on the planet. (HANDING OVER A WAD OF CASH) Here. Will fifty credits cover it? It’s all I’ve got.
(COUNTING MONEY) I may be able to overlook this matter for now. A new arrival? Might I enquire as to the nature of any business you intend to transact here?
I’m looking for a Mr Lonnigan.
You'll find him inside the Chapel of Rest.
Chapel of Rest?
Along the terrace. Up the steps. The rather grand marble archway.
I suppose it must be. (HEADING OFF) Thanks.
A LIFE OF CRIME (FINAL) Page 5
SCENE 3: INT. CHAPEL OF REST
GLORIA’S HEELS CLICK ACROSS MARBLE HALL.
That’s it? Everyone’s gone?
Yeah. Pretty good turnout all in all.
What would you know, Mr Later? You’re still wet behind the ears.
Well. It’s the kind of crowd I’d be happy with at my funeral.
Let’s hope that’s a long way off. (PATTING CASKET LID) Now you, the dear departed. You’re going on a long journey.
PRESSES BUTTON, WHICH STARTS CONVEYOR BELT MOVING.
There it goes. All the way down to Ricosta’s incineration and burials department. Or whatever else they want to do with the bodies.
(URGENT) Gloria, can we talk about-
Not now, Nathan. Get the hoverboat ready. I’m still hoping one more guest turns up.
All right. (HEADS TOWARDS DOORS) I guess it can wait till we’re on the island.
AS NATHAN REACHES EXIT, MEL ENTERS.
(CALLING BACK) Actually, that guest might be here!
(AT ENTRANCE) Mr Lonnigan?
No. (EXITING) You should go on through.
WALKS THROUGH CHAPEL TOWARDS GLORIA.
A LIFE OF CRIME (FINAL) Page 6
(APPROACHING) Hello? I’m looking for Lefty Lonnigan.
Sorry, darling. You just missed him.
We were supposed to have a rendezvous. Organised by a mutual friend of ours. I think I might be a bit late.
No. I’m afraid he is. The ‘late’ Lefty Lonnigan.
Oh. I see. Chapel of Rest. Sorry I missed him.
We’ve all just said our fond farewells. Sent the coffin on its way to the hereafter. (WALKS OVER) And you are Miss Melanie Bush. Late to the funeral.
How do you know who I am? Who are you?
I know lots of things. And the answer to your other question is.. complicated. Come out to the beach. I’ve got transport laid on.
A LIFE OF CRIME (FINAL) Page 7
SCENE 4: INT. MAYOR’S OFFICES
HURRIES INTO OFFICES.
Secretary Valla!
HURRIES UP.
Yes sir?
Put these in my safe, please.
OVER BAGS OF CHINKING COINS.
Yes, sir.
And these.
THROUGH WADS OF NOTES AND HANDS THEM OVER.
Cold hard cash has its advantages. But it takes a while to filter through the system.
Indeed, sir.
Prepare tax receipts for Miss Swannicker and the other donors. We require all charitable contributions to be on record. Above board and beyond reproach. That’s how we like to keep things.
Of course, sir. How was the funeral?

So sad when we lose another of our long-standing — and most spendthrift - residents. Remind me, I need to work out the death duties and interment charges. (GOING INTO OFFICE) To pass on to the Lonnigan estate.
GOES OFF INTO OFFICE. RIFLES PAPERS ON DESK.
(OFF, IN OFFICE) What are these?
A LIFE OF CRIME (FINAL) Page 8
(CALLING) Messages. From S.I. Holdings.
(OFF) There are dozens of them.
RINGS. MAYOR RUSHES BACK TO HIS DOOR.
Don’t answer th-
(ANSWERING PHONE) Ricosta Administration.
Don’t tell them I’m-
(TO PHONE) The Mayor’s just walked in. He’s in his office. Shall I put you through?
Who is it? As if I didn’t know...
Isn’t that funny? We were just talking about them. S.I. Holdings. I’1l put them through for you now, sir.
(NERVOUS GULP) If you must.
WALKS BACK INTO OFFICE. DESKPHONE TRILLS. MAYOR SLAMS
DOOR.
A LIFE OF CRIME (FINAL) Page 9
SCENE 5: EXT. HOVERBOAT
MOTORING OVER LAPPING WAVES. SEABIRDS CRY. GLORIA
ACROSS DECK AND PICKS UP A BOTTLE FROM ICE BUCKET.
Funerals. Depressing things. Still, let’s not dwell on the past. Here’s to the future.
POP OF CORK, FIZZ AND CLINKING AS CHAMPAGNE POURED FROM BOTTLE INTO GLASSES.
Gadalaxian champagne, Miss Bush?
Not just now, thanks. It’s a pity. I was hoping Mr Lonnigan would be able to help me.
And why might you be needing help?
Well, you see, I’m in rather a lot of trouble.
Really? You don’t look the type.
You didn’t say who you were.
(CALLING, OFF AT HELM) Gloria! We’re almost there!
‘Gloria’... who?
(CALLING) Mr Later! I believe the correct expression is ‘Secret Island Ahoy!’ (TO MEL) He’s the new boy. How did you get to Ricosta?
My ship. The ‘Nosferatu Three’. They impounded it at customs. I couldn’t pay the landing tax.
Of course. Though it’s not your ship really, is it? It’s the property of Mr Sabalom Glitz.
You do know something, then? Maybe you can help me instead.
A LIFE OF CRIME (FINAL) Page 10
Oh, I’m sure I can. Once we’re safe on dry land.
ENGINES SLOW, THEN REV AS THEY PULL INTO DOCK. GLORIA
UP AND WALKS TO SIDE.
Ready the ramp, Mr Later! We’re going ashore!
A LIFE OF CRIME (FINAL) Page 11
SCENE 6: EXT. SECRET ISLAND, DOCK
PULLS UP AT DOCK, THEN IDLES. HUM AS RAMP EXTENDS AND GLORIA AND MEL WALK ACROSS THROUGH FOLLOWING. DISTANT TROPICAL
CREATURES AND CHIRPING.

This way, Mel! (WALKING) They go back a long, long way, dear old Lefty and your ship’s owner. A mutual arrangement of investment and support. He bought this island with the proceeds from their Iceworld job.
(FOLLOWING) Iceworld? Oh. That’s where I met Glitz.
I know. And Lefty had been following your career with interest, Melanie.

Me? Then he must know we’re in deep trouble. Glitz always said he could rely on Lefty Lonnigan if ever we got into a really tight corner. He told me all about the retirement villa on Ricosta. He was planning on joining him one day. I liked the sound of the place — beaches, pools, fabulous restaurants.
My my, he has been quite an influence, hasn’t he?
But now we’re in real dire straits, Glitz has vanished. I thought he might have come here?
No. No sign of him. Not even at his best friend’s funeral. Then again, ‘honour among thieves’ is a slippery commodity.
Tell me about it! He’s run out and left me owing a lot of money to some very unsavoury types.
THEY WALK ON ALONG A PATH. NATHAN HURRIES TO CATCH UP.
Secret Island Ahoy, ladies.
This is Nathan. Our pilot — among other things. He can show us the way inside.
Impressive obelisk. What is it? Some kind of sculpture?
A LIFE OF CRIME (FINAL) Page 12
Lefty always had a liking for abstract art. Didn’t understand it. Just thought buying it made him look clever. Open it up will you, Nathan.
Of course. Step this way.
TAPS IN A CODE, ELECTRONIC HUM AND SCRAPING OF ROCK AS
OPEN UP.
Oh, it’s not just a monument. It’s a building.
Nothing gets past you, does it, Melanie?
What’s the point of a secret island, if it doesn’t have a secret hideaway? This way, Miss Bush.
THEY WALK INSIDE.
A LIFE OF CRIME (FINAL) Page 13
SCENE 7: INT. MAYOR’S OFFICE
IS ON THE PHONE TO SPEROVORE.
S. I. Holdings have been extremely generous. I am the first to admit-
(FX, VIA PHONE) Some might say too generous. We expect a return on our investments.
But as you know, the economy here is very finely balanced.
(D) The scales are tipping away from your favour.
I couldn’t have known the grotzit index would fall so low. The Ricostan dollar is just going through a very bad patch.
(D) We take financial responsibility very seriously. We had certain requirements when we offered the bail-out to your economy. Not all those requirements have been met.
We should really have entered the common currency when we had the chance.
(D) You cannot profit from decisions not taken.
No. Of course. You would know all about that.
(D) And we feel it is time we cut our losses - any further losses.
We should have a new influx of residents very soon.
(D) Applications have been falling year on year for the past decade.
I know. I know. But those that do come bring great wealth. I am introducing a regime of taxation, but-
A LIFE OF CRIME (FINAL) Page 14
(D) Soon there will be no-one left.
Then there are the tourists-
(D) Our uses for them are... limited. You know we require the bio-signatures of your permanent residents for the process.
I’m sorry. I’m sorry. I really am grateful that you stepped in to support us in Ricosta’s hour of need. But I understood the investment strategy was always long-term-
(D) That term is up.
Please. A few more years-
(D) We will see how the latest import tastes when our agent has prepared it. We are due in a board meeting. We always look forward to the menu on such occasions.
I’m sure you’ll find it very agreeable. One of our most colourful residents.
(D) We will be in touch soon, with our final decision. Goodbye, Mr Mayor.
A pleasure doing business. As always.
PHONE DOWN.
(TERRIFIED) An absolute pleasure.
A LIFE OF CRIME (FINAL) Page 15
SCENE 8: INT. SECRET HIDEAWAY.
SLIDES OPEN INTO CONFERENCE ROOM. GLORIA AND MEL DESCEND
STEPS OUTSIDE AND ENTER.
Sorry about all the steps, Mel.
Not a problem.
SLIDES CLOSED BEHIND.
This is what I wanted to show you.
A conference room? Under an obelisk, on a tropical island.
Sometimes, things are just what they appear to be. More of my associates will be joining us. But before all that, I should get you up to speed. With a little show and tell.
‘Show and tell’? What is this? School assembly? Listen, I don’t mean to sound rude, but who are you?
All will become abundantly clear to you very, very soon. (WALKS OVER TO CONTROLS) All right. So here is the show.
PRESSES BUTTONS. A SHUTTER OPENS.
(GASP) The TARDIS. But... that means...
Yes.
Is he here? Can I see him?
You'd better sit down. This might come as a bit of a shock. You came here to see Lefty Lonnigan. And I’m showing you a TARDIS. Let me fill you in on how the two are connected...
MUSIC TRANSITION TO FLASHBACK THROUGH:
A LIFE OF CRIME (FINAL) Page 16
(VOICEOVER) The first Mr Lonnigan knew of this box, was when he picked it up on the security cameras outside his villa on the
mainland. One week ago...
A LIFE OF CRIME (FINAL) Page 17
SCENE 9: EXT. RICOSTAN VILLA GROUNDS
LAPPING, OFF. TARDIS MATERIALISES UNDER FOLLOWING, THEN OPENS. DOCTOR AND ACE STEP OUT. SEA IN DISTANCE, SEA BIRDS,
WAY OFF.
Nice. Should have brought a bucket and spade.
I doubt we’ll have time for sandcastles, Ace.
No. Looks like we got here too late. Someone’s already built a pretty impressive fortress.
Fortress. Luxury villa. One and the same on Ricosta.
That’s where we are, is it? Ricosta?
THEY START WALKING OVER SAND ONTO PAVED PATH UNDER FOLLOWING.
Yes. A retirement haven for a certain type of business person. Tropical climate. Untouched beaches. Fabulous cuisine. And no extradition treaties.
Right. That type of business person.
I wonder why the TARDIS brought us here? She’s normally quite select about who she mixes with.
Then again, you did steal her in the first place.
There is that. Shall we take a look around?
MUSIC SEGUE TO:
A LIFE OF CRIME (FINAL) Page 18
SCENE 10: EXT. OUTSIDE LEFTY’S VILLA
CLIMBING FENCE.
(EFFORT, CALLING DOWN) Told you the fence wasn’t electrified.
You take the high road and I’11 take the...
SCREWDRIVER BUZZ. GATES CLANK OPEN.
. door.
CLIMBS AND DROPS DOWN FROM FENCE BESIDE DOCTOR.
Show-off.
Someone is living in the lap of luxury. Two pools. An outside sauna and hot tub. Balconies on every vista.
Yeah, but we just walked straight in. You’d think the criminal mind would be thinking a little more about security.
(OVER P.A SYSTEM) Oh, I think about it. A lot. Hold it right there, you two. My boys will come and get ya.
SECURITY GUARDS CLANK TOWARDS THEM.
(CLOSE) Android sentries. Reckon you can knock them out with some sonic swizzling?
(CLOSE) Let’s keep that up our sleeves, shall we? Allow ourselves to be captured and taken straight to the top. Then we might discover who needs our help.
(ALOUD) So, who would live in a house like this? (CRIES OUT,
CLAMP THEM BOTH AND DRAG THEM OFF.
We’re about to find out. (GRABBED BY ROBOTS) Ow. Careful with the elbow! I’ve only got the two! (SHORT MUSIC TRANSITION TO: )
A LIFE OF CRIME (FINAL) Page 19
SCENE 11: INT. LEFTY’S VILLA
SECURITY GUARDS DRAG ACE AND DOCTOR INSIDE. LEFTY WALKS
THEM — HALF HIS BODY IS CYBERNETIC, FOOTSTEPS ALTERNATES WITH ROBOTIC CLUNKS.
So you’re saying you broke into my house to see if I need any help?
In a roundabout way.

Think of it as a complimentary security assessment. Well, now we've seen you’re quite capable of looking after yourself, (EDGES TOWARD DOOR) we should probably just be on our- [way] (GRABBED BY SECURITY ROBOT) Ow!
I think they’re insisting we stay.
What are you anyway? Some kind of cyborg?
(WARNING) Ace! (TO LEFTY) I’m sorry about my friend. She has an enquiring mind.
Don’t tell me you’ve never heard of ‘Lefty Lonnigan’.
We haven’t, I’m afraid. (BEAT, REALISATION) Oh, I see. ‘Lefty’ because-
It’s only the left side of your body that’s still human.
(MENACING) Yeah.
CLUNKS FORWARD AS NATHAN APPROACHES OPEN DOOR AND KNOCKS.
What is it?
Mr Lonnigan?
Oh yeah. The new boy. Come in, why don’t you. Norman, isn’t it?
A LIFE OF CRIME (FINAL) Page 20
(ENTERING) Nathan, sir. Nathan Later.
(CLOSE) Doctor? I’m thinking now’s the time to poke around up your sleeve...
FIDDLES INSIDE HIS JACKET.
(CLOSE) Already doing it, Ace.
What should we do with these two, new boy?
Well...
Tell you what, while you’re making your minds up-
SCREWDRIVER BUZZ. SENTRIES BEEP AND SPIN. SECURITY ALARMS TRIP.
We’1ll just be outside! (RUNS)
(RUNNING) Getting some air! Goodbye!
ACE AND DOCTOR PUSH PAST NATHAN AND RUN OUT OF DOOR.
Oof!
(RUNNING, OUTSIDE) Ace! This way!
A LIFE OF CRIME (FINAL) Page 21
SCENE 12: EXT. VILLA GROUNDS
BLARING. DOCTOR AND ACE RUNNING ALONG PATHS THROUGHOUT.
Where’s the TARDIS gone? It should be right outside the gate!
It seems Lefty’s security droids may have acquired it.
Once a thief, always a thief.
In which case, we need to go back inside and find it.
LOTS OF SECURITY ROBOTS START CLANKING TOWARDS THEM.
I suppose we do. This way! There must be another way in. How
many of those robot things are there?
Too many! Ace! Back around here!
THEY RUN OFF AGAIN.
A LIFE OF CRIME (FINAL) Page 22
SCENE 13: INT. LEFTY’S VILLA
NATHAN AT CONTROLS. MONITORS SHOW ACE AND DOCTOR RUNNING.
(ON-SCREEN, RUNNING IN DISTANCE) No. Not that way. This way!
(ON-SCREEN, RUNNING IN DISTANCE) Right behind you.
FOOTSTEPS AND PURSUING ROBOTS CONTINUE ON SCREENS UNDER FOLLOWING.
They’re outside.
Then it’s time to prove your mettle, new boy.
We’ve got cameras on them. They won’t get far.
Good. They’d better not trample my azaleas.
They’re heading past the pools. I’ve managed to get all the sentries back online. And I think I’ve filtered out whatever Signal came off that sonic weapon of his.
PRESSES MORE SECURITY CONTROLS.
Good. Very good. He can’t play that trick again.
No. And I’m bringing in the spares from the perimeter too.
Nice tech skills. Where did we hire you from again?
I’ve been freelancing. I heard you looked after your own, Mr Lonnigan. Just want to do my bit to help. Earn my keep.
We’ve a job lined up that you could be a good fit for. I’1ll see what my associates think when they arrive.
What kind of job?
A LIFE OF CRIME (FINAL)
Let’s deal with these visitors first.
There. We’ve got them cornered. By the
Then let’s bring ‘em in.
Page 23
sauna terrace.
A LIFE OF CRIME (FINAL) Page 24
SCENE 14: EXT. VILLA GARDENS
JACCUZZI B/G. DOCTOR AND ACE RUNNING TOWARD IT OVER
BOARDS. ROBOT SENTRIES CLOSING IN. DOCTOR STOPS.
What are you doing? I don’t think we’ve got time for a jaccuzzi!
(STOPPING) Just a moment!
STARTS USING SONIC SCREWDRIVER. WATER BUBBLES MORE FURIOUSLY.
Steam, Ace! It should give you some cover! Let’s abandon the villa for now. Get outside the grounds so we can catch our breath.
Right. (RUNS)
RUNS OFF TO FENCE AND STARTS CLIMBING. CLANKING SECURITY
COME CLOSER AND WHIR IN CONFUSION.
(CALLING) Come on then!
I can’t. As soon as I move, the steam will disappear and the robots will head straight for you. Get back over the fence!
(OFF) No, Doctor. I’m not leaving you.
Then come back quickly! With help. (CRIES OUT AS SENTRIES GRAB HIM)
GRAB THE DOCTOR. SONIC STOPS BUZZING. ACE DROPS OUTSIDE.
I’ll find whoever’s in charge of this place! Don’t worry Doctor. They can’t do this! (RUNS OFF)
(VIA P.A.) We got one at least. Bring him inside. The boss wants to have a word.
A LIFE OF CRIME (FINAL) Page 25
SCENE 15: INT. MAYOR’S OFFICE
THUMPS MAYOR'S DESK. PAPERS GO FLYING.
You've got to do something! You’re supposed to be the Mayor!
I, young lady, do not have to do anything.
Don’t you believe me? You must know there’s a bunch of crooks living on your planet.
GATHERS PAPERS TOGETHER AGAIN.
It’s not a question of whether I believe you. I’m quite certain that what you describe may well have happened.
So? What are you gonna do about it?
I? Um. Nothing.
Nothing?
Nothing.
I’m gonna take this up a level then. Who’s your boss, fur-face?
Young woman, I am the Lord Mayor of Ricosta. The highest authority.
(REALISATION) I get it. You’re in their pocket. Of course. If this place is some ‘Costa Del Crime’ planet, then it stands to reason the authorities are in on the action. What’s your cut?
My ‘cut’?
You know. How much do the gangsters bung you to turn a blind eye? From the look of the villas out there, I’d say they’re probably selling you short.
A LIFE OF CRIME (FINAL) Page 26

I refute the accusation, young woman! I am extremely gratified that so many successful business men and women have seen fit to retire to Ricosta. Our economy reaps many benefits from such a diverse range of interests.
You’re raking it in and you don’t want to rock the boat. Fair enough. I’1l deal with it myself.
Young woman!
SUDDENLY REACHES ACROSS DESK AND GRABS MAYOR.
(GRABBED) Urrk!
(CLOSE, THREATENING) ‘Young woman’ me one more time, and you’1l be wearing that bushy tail of yours as a snood.
A... a.. what?
A ‘snood’!
K-kindly release me!
Your back end’s gonna feel a bit chillier. But, on the upside... you'll have invented the snood.
Do not threaten me in my own office. (CALLING) Valla! Get
Security!
No need! I’m going. (PUSHING HIM AWAY)
PUSHES THE MAYOR BACK IN HIS SEAT. THEN STORMS OUT, SLAMMING THE DOOR.
What a disagreeable person!
SOUNDS OF SCUFFLE OUTSIDE AS ACE PUSHES PAST SECRETARY.
(OFF) Oof!
A LIFE OF CRIME (FINAL) Page 27
(OFF) Don’t bother trying to stop me!
(AT DOOR) Mr Mayor? What happened?
If that young woman comes anywhere near these offices again... arrest her!
A LIFE OF CRIME (FINAL) Page 28
SCENE 16: INT. LEFTY’S VILLA
CLUNKS AROUND ROOM.
What are we gonna do with you, then?
That’s rather up to you. Isn’t it time you told me? Why am I here?
I haven’t the foggiest who you are.

My Ship has been homing in on someone in need of our help. I thought it was someone female. Given you’ve got me tied up, at gunpoint, I’d hazard a guess that it’s not you. (BEAT) Unless she’s taking a more holistic view of things...
Help? You seem more like a hindrance to me.
How quickly we’ve got to know one another.
I’m busy. I don’t have the patience for burglars. I’m waiting for some business partners to arrive on Ricosta. We’ve got a little job on.
I’m guessing it’s nothing innocent. Like a bathroom extension?
Anyway. Why would I — Lefty Lonnigan, the most successful career criminal this sector’s ever known — why would I be asking some stranger for help?
I don’t know. What happened, Mr Lonnigan? I mean, your prosthetics. The injuries must have been very severe.
Things went wrong. On a job. I was lucky to end up in a state- of-the-art medi-facility. The Krytomp Bio-Infirmary. Out by Andromeda. In the Golden Dragon Nebula. Very swish. Do you know ah es
I’ve heard of its work. Pioneering reconstructive surgery.
A LIFE OF CRIME (FINAL) Page 29
Yeah, well. It’s all a long time ago now.
The folly of youth, eh?
What are you? Some kind of intergalactic missionary?
I’ve been called worse.
Hang on. You call yourself ‘The Doctor’?
Yes.
And that blue box. You called it a ship.
Not just any ship. The TARDIS.
(CHUCKLES) Of course. I’m being so flamin’ slow! The old rascal. He can’t make it along himself, so he arranges some specialist assistance. You did come here to help me!
Now I think I’m being slow, Mr Lonnigan.
CLUNKS OVER TOWARDS DOCTOR.
The Doctor. The TARDIS. Tell me you remember Ravolox? Iceworld? Vandor Prime? Tell me you remember my old mucker, Sabalom Glitz.
A LIFE OF CRIME (FINAL) Page 30
SCENE 17: INT. LEFTY’S VILLA
NIGHT-TIME CRICKETS CHIRPING. ACE SCRAMBLES OVER FENCE. THEN FREEZES.
(EFFORT) (TO SELF, CLOSE) Three. Two. One. And...
A ROBOT SECURITY GUARD PASSES BELOW. ONCE IT MOVES OFF, ACE
DOWN THE OTHER SIDE AND SCURRIES INTO UNDERGROWTH.
(EFFORT) (TO SELF, CLOSE) That’s the beauty of automated security. Runs like clockwork.
SCRABBLES IN BACKPACK.
(TO SELF, CLOSE) Everything I need for a jailbreak. Right-
SHE’S GRABBED FROM BEHIND BY NATHAN. HE PUTS A HAND
HER MOUTH.
(STRUGGLING) Mmmph!
(CLOSE) Shh. Now when I take my hand away, you’re gonna keep shtum. ‘Cos another’s sentry due in about fifteen seconds.
(AGREEING) Mm-hmm. (SHE’S UNMUFFLED) (WHISPER) You! I thought I might have got as far as the terrace before-
I said shh!
SENTRY APPROACHES AND PASSES BY ON PATH.
(WHISPER) What’s it matter? Aren’t you just going to hand me in to your boss?
Am I? (BEAT, AS SENTRY GOES OFF) They’re moving your friend.
(CLOSE) You’re his henchman. That’s what you’re supposed to do isn’t it? Sound the alarm?
A LIFE OF CRIME (FINAL) Page 31
(CLOSE) We’re not all what we seem, are we? Now keep quiet and stay out of sight.
(CLOSE) Hang on. What did you say? They’re moving him? You mean the Doctor? Where?
DOORS OPEN. LEFTY AND HENCHMEN SHOVE ‘DOCTOR’ (REALLY GLORIA IN DISGUISE) OUT ONTO PORCH.
(OFF, AT DOOR) Move it.
(CLOSE) Here they come now. Stay down. Lefty owns an island a
mile off the coast. I’d guess that’s where he’s going.
(MUFFLED, ACTUALLY A RECORDING) I object to this treatment.
SCUFFLING AT THE VILLA DOOR.
(CLOSE) Oh no.
(OFF, AT DOOR) Watch it! He’s making a break for it!
‘DOCTOR’ STARTS RUNNING.
A LIFE OF CRIME (FINAL) Page 32
SCENE 18: EXT. LEFTY’S VILLA TERRACE
‘DOCTOR’ RUNS.
(OFF, ACTUALLY A RECORDING) I’m leaving! Now!
Don’t let him escape! Shoot him down!
WEAPON BARRAGE FROM SENTRIES.
(OFF, CALLING) Doctor!
(GRABBING HER) No. You’1ll only run into the line of fire.
WEAPON FIRES AND HITS ‘DOCTOR’ — ‘HE’ FALLS.
No!

(FX) Attention all residents of Ricosta!

SCENE 68: INT. SECRET HIDEAWAY

PLAYBACK.
(VIA MONITOR, FX) Repeat. Sperovore Investment Holdings is foreclosing on Ricosta. Ricosta is closed for business. Ricostan space is restricted. Do not enter. Repeat.

CITIES, SMASHING BUILDINGS, PEOPLE FLEEING, ON SCREEN.

They’re keeping everything hidden, while they strip every living thing off the planet. Are we safe on the island?
Won't be long before they find us. They’re looking for all life forms. So they can squeeze out their possibilities and serve them up for their collective dinner.
How are we supposed to get away? (BEAT, PRESSES COMMS) I know. I can contact them. Show my warrant card.

You think that will make the slightest bit of difference? One policeman? They’1ll eat you along with everyone else.
STOPS.
To the outside universe, Ricosta is closed for business. Down here... well, it’s gonna be a feeding frenzy. (BEAT) Nathan, honey. I think I need another phone call.

GRABBING PEOPLE.

SCREWDRIVER BUZZES VERY HIGH PITCHED.

SCENE 72: EXT. ALONG STREET
WITHDRAW.
(OFF, IN STREET) (FX) I will consult the board.
(CALLING, OFF IN STREET) Everybody. Stay back! Let me deal with them.
RUNS UP TO ACE AND MAYOR.
(CALLING, RUNNING) Ace! Wait. You don’t need guns!

The Doctor’s talking to them. But I’m not sure what he’s offering.

Don’t you see? While big, slimy and ugly is out here. Who’s down in the vault?
No-one.
Exactly. Mr Mayor? You’re coming with me.
Are you sure that’s wise?
We should probably wait and see what the Doctor-
Listen, Donut. Sorry. But I’ve been doing this a lot, lot longer than you ever did.

Ace-
It’s easy. The monster’s out of the vault. The Doctor’s keeping it busy so we can get to the TARDIS.
And then what? You can’t actually fly it. (BEAT) Oh. You think you can?
Not just ‘think’. I’ve been having lessons. You stay here, out of trouble. Me and Tufty will go and do the heavy lifting.
I’ve been out there too. Travelling the universe-
Yeah. Raking off a tidy profit. Not so much of the saving planets.
That’s not fair-
Leave it to me. Are you in, Mr Mayor?
I’m all for going anywhere those things aren’t. The Vault. It’s underground. Secure. Lockable. You’ve convinced me. But it’s all the way across town.
Then we’d better get a shift on. (CALLING) Keep an eye on the Doctor, Donut!
(TO SELF, ANNOYED) The name is Melanie.

SCENE 73: INT. SECRET ISLAND HIDEAWAY
PACING, ON PHONE.

Shh!
(VIA PHONE, FX) Miss Swannicker. A pleasure. I hear you’re down on Ricosta. Mmm. Delightfully spicy so far.
MURMURS OF AGREEMENT IN B/G
(VIA PHONE, FX) We’re all enjoying them very much here in the boardroom.
Riiiight. (BEAT) That’s my issue, you see. I’m here, but I’m not a resident asset. I’d like to enquire after some kind of exit.
(VIA PHONE, FX) I see.
Check my records. You’1l see I’ve brought you many, many lucrative prospects in the past. And I hope to continue to do so in the future, so long as I remain alive enough to achieve that end.
(VIA PHONE, FX) That is an impressive record, Miss Swannicker.

(VIA PHONE, FX) Hold one moment.

PRINTING.

(FX) Hmm. We will commune, check the accounts. We have been propping up the economy of this planet for a very long time.
(APPROACHING) I think you can afford it. Several galaxies would need to go bust before you’d even notice a dent.
Mel. I told everyone to stay back.
You should remember, Doctor. I don’t always do what I’m told.
(FX) Ah yes. This one. Melanie Bush. She is also in our ledgers.
Really?
(FX) She is of exceptional value.

(FX) But Miss Bush. She has the scent of many realities, many different universes. (SNIFFING) What an aroma. Intoxicating.
Charmed, I’m sure.

Ricosta was such a beautiful world.
You’re the one who asked the gangsters to move in.

This one. He’s the one you’ve an argument with. He messed up this world. Have an appetiser on me.

THEY CREEP TOWARDS DOORWAY.

TENTACLES APPROACH

SCENE 86: INT. MAYOR’S OFFICE
What, Doctor? What can you offer to match Melanie Bush?
Something of mine. Something I’ve been protecting all the while I’ve been here.
